solution.text:
Let the Ajay's present age be x.
Then the Ajay's father's present age be x + _{i}_
After 3 years:
Ajay's age will be = x + 3
His father's age will be = x + _{i}_ + 3 = x + _{{i+3}}_
Therefore,
Their product = \((x+3)\times (x+_{{i+3}}_)\)
i.e., _{{2*i*i}}_ = \((x+3)\times (x+_{{i+3}}_)\)
i.e., _{{2*i*i}}_ = \((x+3)\times (x+3+_{i}_)\)
Let x+3 = t
Then,
i.e., _{{2*i*i}}_ = \(t\times (t+_{i}_)\)
i.e., _{{2*i*i}}_ = \(t^2 + _{i}_t\)
i.e., \(t^2 + _{i}_t - _{{2*i*i}}_ = 0\)
i.e., \(t^2 + _{{2*i}}_t - _{i}_t - _{{2*i*i}}_ = 0\)
i.e., \(t(t + _{{2*i}}_) - _{i}_(t + _{{2*i}}_) = 0\)
i.e., (t = -_{{2*i}}_) and (t = _{i}_)
Therefore, x = -_{{(2*i)+3}}_ and x = _{{i-3}}_
Since x is the age of Ajay, it can not be negative
Thus, the age of Ajay is _{{i-3}}_ years and his father's age = _{{i+i-3}}_
Therefore,
Sum of their ages = _{{i-3}}_ + _{{i+i-3}}_ = _{{i-3+i+i-3}}_

content.text: Ajay's father is _{i}_ years older than him. The product of their ages (in years) 3 years from now will be _{{2*i*i}}_. Find the sum of their present ages.
